name: Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations
goal: The Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations (FEMA) is the European federation of national road rider organisations. FEMA represents, defends and promotes motorcycling and the interests of million of powered two-wheeler users across Europe. Through its 23 national organisations from 18  countries, FEMA reaches directly 272,000 dedicated motorcyclists representing all social groups.
interests: Consumers, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: EU transport policy, EU road safety strategy, PPE, C-ITS, ADAS, (semi-)automatic driving, urban mobility, EU and UN environment policy, EU energy policy, energy transition, driving licences, sound emissions, EU and UN technical demands regulations, General Safety Regulation, review of the Road Infrastructure Safety Management Directive, internalisation of external costs.
